notesStmt.note: Several larger lacunae. The first quire is lost and the last quire is imperfect. Folia 1-4 and 141-154 supply the defects.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Hagiographa, provided with vowel-points and accents, masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: Originally upwards of 18 quires of 8 leaves each. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last pages, and with Arabic words on the first page. Catchwords present throughout.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, punctuated, of 16th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 42v Small ornamental pen and ink designs at the end of the book of Psalms and Job.
58v Small ornamental pen and ink designs at the end of the book of Psalms and Job.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881, folio [155v].
